p: D. bulbifera fresh leaves were collected at Kampung Peta, Johor, Malaysia, on 5 th May 2017 with the permission of Perbadanan Taman Negara Johor (PTJN) and with full observation of rules and regulations on collection practices of medicinal plants as laid down by the World Health Organisation (WHO) collection of plant materials [ 7]. Identification was made, and the voucher specimen was deposited in the Herbarium of Centre of Research for Sustainable Uses of Natural Resources (CoR-SUNR), Faculty of Applied Sciences and Technology, Universiti Tun Hussein Onn Malaysia. Fresh sample was cleaned using tap water to eliminate impurities or soil debris. The sample was crushed to a fine powder with an electric blender after shade drying at room temperature and kept in a zip lock bag in a freezer (−20°C) for further analysis [ 8, 9].
